description.narrative: The project envisages integrated rural development approach to address economic and social disparities of the most vulnerable population in two districts of Zerafshan Valley (Ayni and Kuhistoni Mastchoh).

activity-description.narrative: Zerafshan Valley of Sodg Oblast, Ayni and Kuhistoni Mastchoh districts, Republic of Tajikistan

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: - At least 10 young people participated in the comprehensive trainings course on various topics of small and medium business development developed and microcapital grants to 6 public organizations for promotion of supportive business environment and supporting local income generating initiatives for women and young entrepreneurs in target districts - At least 100 rural women and unemployed youth improved access to vocational trainings and professional education - At least 7 initiatives of rural women and youth supported and improved access to finance their business initiatives - At least 800 beneficiaries have improved access to secondary education in remote and rural areas; - At least 1,000 people, including rural women have improved access to quality services in local health facilities; - 1 Awareness raising campaign for 3,000 local populations, including: rural women, migrants’ wives and young people, schoolchildren attending 9-11 grades are conducted. - At least 200 members of migrants’ families receiving consultations addressing negative social effects of migration, such as divorces, discrimination and domestic violence, abandonment of rights, non-registration of marriages and divorces, settlement of alimony disputes, etc.

- 52 young people participated in the comprehensive trainings course on various topics of small and medium business development; - 6 grants were awarded for promotion of supportive business environment and supporting local income generating initiatives for women and young entrepreneurs in target districts - 140 rural women and unemployed youth improved access to vocational trainings and professional education - 9 initiatives of rural women and youth supported and improved access to finance their business initiatives - 840 beneficiaries have improved access to secondary education in remote and rural areas; - 2,300 people, including rural women have improved access to quality services in local health facilities; - several awareness raising campaigns for 3,000 local populations, including: rural women, migrants’ wives and young people, schoolchildren attending 9-11 grades are conducted. - 207 members of migrants’ families receiving consultations addressing negative social effects of migration, such as divorces, discrimination and domestic violence, abandonment of rights, non-registration of marriages and divorces, settlement of alimony disputes, etc.
